critique: The document discusses the transfer of duties, powers, and functions of the Radio Division of the Department of Commerce to the Federal Radio Commission. It outlines the abolishment of the Radio Division, transfer of records and property, and the transfer/dismissal of officers and employees. It also discusses the continuation of existing orders, rules, and regulations, and the transfer of appropriations. The document centralizes power in the Federal Radio Commission and gives the president authority to make changes in titles, designations, and duties of officers and employees.
